text:
What are some responsibilities / qualifications you would put into an entry-level/junior content strategist position? Any ideas are on the table, please spitball!

(Context: I run the 2-person content side of a small SEO agency. This person would produce lots of content briefs, do keyword research, and do some light managing-editor tasks, like corresponding with freelance writers/editors, filing invoices. Writing/editing background would be key (copy editing chops, applying style guides to written content). TIA!

edit: please tag me in any other threads that might echo this — I know this topic comes up in this Slack quite a bit

text: I was going to suggest having a team member dedicated to helping with non-blog/content marketing work...I know it all contributes, but if that person is solely dedicated to CRO & copywriting, you'll probably have better results as well
